text: I have been challenged!

Now as a Brit I am going to make it a point
of visiting more of the UK this year

To be honest a lot of visitors and travellers
only ever hit up London
There are other places.
So let me convince you.

So GoEuro who is the sponsor of this video,
yes, yes.
*claps*

Have challenged me to visit 3 cities, in 3
days, in 3 different ways

GoEuro are a fantastic travel app which allows
you to compare and look up buses, trains and
flights all over Europe

and you get to see it all neat and nice in
one place so you can decide what’s the best
value for you for getting around

The reason I genuinely like GoEuro is not
only is it just really convenient for you
to see all of the different prices

of different types of transport all in one
place.

But you can book and have your ticket popped
in your little GoEuro wallet on the app
so you don’t have to worry about anything

So in the next 3 days, we are starting from
Birmingham and we are heading more up north
and the first stop is Manchester

Ok so I’ve just got to Birmingham New Street,
It’s only an hour and a half on the train
so that’s nice.
and it takes me straight to Manchester Piccadilly
Oh I love that.

Platform 7b, I don’t even need to check
the boards
Open ticket.
Yas.

It was so easy to book as well guys, honestly,
and having the ticket right here for buses
and trains it’s brilliant
so, let’s go to Manchester!

(Speaker system) This is your cross country
service to Manchester Piccadilly

this service will be Wolverhampton, Stafford,
Stoke-on-trent, Macclesfield, Stockport, arriving
Manchester Piccadilly at 9.29 this morning

OK, so I have arrived Manchester Piccadilly
and as soon as I step outside, there is a
sign for a free city bus

But luckily for me, I didn’t need it as
my accommodation was literally less than a
30 second walk from the station
Wow, what a colourful welcome to Manchester!

Alright, so I can’t check in yet but we
are going to head to the police museum

Which I’ll tell you a bit more about when
we get there
So cool, look at that.
Yes, Manchester, brining up the artistic goods

So this is the “crime room” this is really
cool

Did you know they have breathalysers back
in the 80’s, I didn’t
This is really interesting.
Look at the detail, cigarette buts.
This is fascinating.

When you put these handcuffs on somebody,
you can get one on, but trying to get the
other one on is impossible.

So when you’re arresting somebody with this
one, if that’s somebody’s wrist, hold
their arm out, that’s it.
It’s on, it’s locked on
So they gave them this, it’s quite loud

So, any officer who’s within the area hears
that could come running towards it

It’s now changed, you’re found guilty
as charged

The Magistrates give out the verdict, police
officer here by the door will get a nod from
the clark of the court
They will bang on this door (bangs)
once they bang on that door it will open inside

I am honestly so impressed with this place
and having someone there to explain
different handcuffs, techniques, everything.
It’s so cool.
10/10, come here.

This is not what I expected
I just expected it to be rooms full of like

stuff, but there are people here you can talk
to
and they’ll explain things.
Brilliant, really good and free.
Crazy it’s free.
Only on Tuesday’s though.

I look at my watch and I realised I spent
way too long in the crime room reading all
the stories

you can see forged diamonds, fake gold that
were seized in real crimes.
So interesting

Ok so I’ve just met up with one of my followers,
Jessica, who works at one of the shops in
Afflecks

and she took me to pick out the perfect hand
made bath bomb
It reminded me a lot of Oasis market in Birmingham

Just floor after floor of stalls, pop-ups
and hidden gems.
Not to be missed
I just checked in.
Oh, that lighting though.
Quick tour!
Girl, how you doing?
Toilet, very important
Bedroom!

And a very nice, dimly lit little kitchenette,
table and 2 sofas
The John Rylands library.

That’s where we are going because apparently
it looks like Hogwarts.

and, don’t hate me, I like Harry Potter
but I’m not super fan.

But it just looks like Hogwarts, I’m down
for that.

I will travel and guess what, we can get the
free bus there!
Outside of the station i.e the hotel

because oh my god, I don’t think I’ve
ever been this close to a main train station
before.
Wow.

Got to get that free bus, free bus, I ain’t
paying no money for a bus.
Ok, yeah I get it, it looks like Hogwarts.
Wow.
It’s a bit of a contrast
I’ll take some information.

We have our ‘Women who shaped Manchester’
exhibition.
It’s really good, check it out.
There is a map there for you.

The exhibition is on the first floor, the
historical read room is on the third floor
and it’s all free entry.
I’m already glad I came here.
This will be good.

I was just thinking when you’re walking
around Manchester you just stumble across

all these cool places and then literally saw
this.
Holy guacamole.

Ok, so just got back, my hair is showing the
signs of a well explored day
So I hope you enjoyed Manchester!
Got to say, loved that free bus.
Love it.

If I was staying longer I would probably just
sit on it and go in loops.
Amazing

They do have trams here and I am pretty sure
I read online that it’s about £5 or something
like that for a day pass on public transport.

I say, my tip, combination of the free bus
in Manchester to get you to different areas
and the big sights
and yeah, walk, explore.

The Northern quarter I think it’s called,
amazing.

I went there 3 times today I ended up circling
back there.

I’ve already had a pretty early dinner because
I am exhausted after a day of exploring

and I went to a place called little Aladdin,
I was going to go to curry mile, I was going
to, that was always the plan.

The only reason I wanted to go is because
I wanted to have 3 curries and rice.

and I think it’s a Manc thing, I’m not
sure.

I asked Scott who’s from Newcastle, is it
a northern thing?

He never heard of it, I just wanted 3 curries
and rice and it had great reviews and I give
it a solid 8/10

For a fiver, 3 curries and rice, it filled
me up I am stuffed, going to jump in the bath,
but yeah

Can’t complain for a fiver for dinner, I
mean really!
Anyway,
Next destination is Edinburgh!

So we’ll be jumping on the train tomorrow
but for now I am going to relax in a bath
Going to get an early night, lots going on.
I think I’m getting blisters, my goodness.
I’ll see you tomorrow.

OK, back at the station and today we are going
to head to Edinburgh, it’s our longest trip,
3 hours and 9 minutes.
Platform 14, le go!

(announcement) calling at Preston, Lancaster,
Carlisle, Lockerbie, Haymarket and Edinburgh
this service will be formed of 4 coaches.
Coach formation is A, B, C and D.

With A at the very front of the train, D at
the rear and C is where the first class will
be situated.

Once again the next train to arrive at platform
14 will be the 08.26 Transpennine Express
service to Edinburgh
Oh!
We made it, yes Edinburgh is hilly.
Oh wow, I got upgraded!
Really nice.
Got the bathroom.
Yes.
Nice.
Ok, so we made it.

I’m staying at Stay, another Stay, the last
place was called Stay.

We are going to be finding some hidden gems
today in Edinburgh.

Already been to Edinburgh, done the castle,
all that kind of good stuff.

Today, everybody has been going on about a
place called Dean Village
A quick Google search later and holy cow!
It looks amazing!

So I think we are going to do an uber there
as that is the quickest way, it’s about

a half an hour walk, but my feet are almost
bleeding.

Uber is available all over so you don’t
have to worry about that if you come.
So we shall do our first Uber trip.

we shall see how much it costs, I think it’s
about a 15 minute drive away and we shall
go and explore

and you’ll see why people have recommended
it to me when we get there and it does feel
like a hidden gem.

Even though it has thousands of 5 star reviews
on Trip Advisor.
Anyway!

Ok, so, really helpful Uber driver who dropped
me at a really nice scenic point to walk along
the canal up to Deans Village.

however we have been re-routed because there
is part of the path that is closed, so I’m

just going to follow signs and hope for the
best.

Well, this was wonderful but I am freezing
my nick-nacks off, so going to find somewhere
warm with food

I’m enjoying my little walk but don’t
let the blue sky fool you, it’s freezing.

I’ve been to Edinburgh a couple of times
as I’ve said but I’ve never come into
Princes Gardens.
10/10 though, would recommend.
Right, I need to find food and warmth.

Got to say that jacket potato place, it weighed
a tonne when he passed it to me, didn’t
look like much but God it was tasty!
Yas.

It filled me up, I got 2 fillings, big mistake,
don’t do that.
You don’t need two.
I couldn’t finish it.
No way in hell could I finish it.

Great little place, I’m going to link everything
down below, as much as I can and write it
all down so you can come back and check
and know where to go when you come Edinburgh

So I have just popped back to the hotel, just
going to freshen up, take 10 minutes to myself,
we’ve got the tour later

so I don’t want to exhaust myself too much
because we have two hours of walking later
on

for the Dark side of Edinburgh tour, I can’t
wait to show you, I just can’t wait, it’s
going to be amazing.
I’m going to take 10 minutes for myself.
So, freshen up and I’ll see you in a bit!

To start things off, I want to point out where
the coffee house is

… finds his wife in bed with another man
and does the logical thing of strangling her
to death
now the next day he reports his wife missing.

Then her dead body remained in that bed for
a further 20 years

It wasn’t until after his death when they
renovated the place they discovered the wife’s
rotting corpse.

The police noted that that room was still
being used, so whether he was ok sleeping
next to a dead body…
The smell!
Oh, 20 years!?

The personification of death, normally drawn
as a skeleton with a black hood.

They used to bury people 6ft deep, until it
got full, then 4ft deep, then 2ft deep, then
they added more soil and continued the process.
They called it the Edinburgh Lasagne.
Soil, meat, soil, meat, soil, meat.
That tour was go good!

Now, they take you into like graveyards, you
go up Carlton Hill, so everything was pitch
black.

So I am hoping in the edits that I just included
some sound bites but I didn’t include any
of the really good stories,
You’ve got to do it for yourself.
I think it cost me £12.

Sure if you look around you can find some
discount codes and get a couple of quid off.

So worth it, this lighting, so worth it, so
good, 10/10.

I just popped into Bella Italia had a little
food because I was so cold.

If you do that tour in winter, oh my god,
wrap up!

Tomorrow we are getting the bus, we are mixing
it up of course because, 3 cities, 3 ways

So tomorrow we are going to go to the bus
station and get the bus to Glasgow, this will
be my shortest trip
just over an hour I think.

So tomorrow I will take you to the bus station
and yeah.
I just love Edinburgh.

I’m going to get into bed now, I’m all
cosy and warm from the shower so I will see
you tomorrow, we are going to head to Glasgow.

The place I got the most recommendations for,
so, see you there!

Time to pack up old bananaramma and we are
going to head to Glasgow

As I a staying near the Royal Mile which is
on one side, the very hilly side of Edinburgh.

the bus station is all the way over on the
other side, the new more modern side, where
I stayed the last time I visited,

so we are going to jump in an Uber because
we have a suitcase and it’s very hilly,
not down for that, so jump in an Uber

it will take 10 minutes to get there and yes,
going to check into the hotel which is right
next to the bus station

happy days and then we’ll explain what we’ll
be doing in Glasgow.

Got to say, with all honesty, I am obsessed
with having all of my tickets in one app.

Honest to God, I know this is a sponsored
video but literally like train or bus, it

doesn’t matter what company, the tickets
are all in one app

I don’t have to worry about searching through
emails or printing it out, it’s all there.

It’s so reassuring, I don’t even have
to think about it.
Just one click and I can get it.

Genuinely guys, it’s like the best thing
ever.
It is time!
Come on.
I’ll take that.
OK.
Big hoose.
Love that!

Just checked in to the hotel, we got a Holiday
Inn, literally around the corner from the
bus station.
So it took me 45 seconds, 60 seconds to walk.
Brilliant!
10/10 location.
Cannot complain.

Now, I got a lot of recommendations for Glasgow
and there is no way I can do them all in one
day.
It’s just impossible.

It is blue skied out, so I really want to
go up to the Necropolis which is a huge cemetery

on a hill and while we are passing we can
go and see the cathedral as well.

I also need to eat because I haven’t done
that but there are so many places i’ve starred
on Google Maps on the way to the Necropolis
so we are going to find somewhere.

I really want to go and do the free tour of
the city chambers, it starts at 10.30 and
2 tours a day.

So I asked over on the GoEuro’s Locals Facebook
group, which I will link below because it’s
full of good travel vibes.

Everyone is just asking for tips, recommendations,
for cities and travelling.

So I asked on there what to do on this trip
and I got some amazing stuff to do in Glasgow.

One of them is to go and visit as many murals
as you can around the city.
Now, you know I love my street art.

So she gave me a link which pin points everything
on a map where all of these amazing murals
are.

Anyway, going to go out and enjoy Glasgow
now.

The accent, when I walk down the street, I’m
like ‘no idea what you said’ They are
speaking English, kind of.

OK, so according to Maps this is where we
are going to come to sign up for the chamber
tour.
It’s alright.
A little out there.
Gorgeous.

That has got to have been the best breakfast
I have ever eaten.

Yes, it was a little on the pricier side,
but oh my gosh, worth every penny!

Now, yes I am in a toilet, because it’s
too busy out there to vlog.

Yes, 5 years on YouTube, still can’t do
it with that many people.

So we are going to enjoy the bathroom, this
great lighting right here and the baby changing
station.

We are going to head towards the cathedral,
was going to get on a bus but it’s only
one minute longer to walk.
So let’s walk.
Let’s go to the Cathedral.
You tell no one what happened here!
I see the cemetery, on yonder!
This is spectacular.

Certainly not a hidden gem, but glad I didn’t
miss it.
Look at this day.
This is honestly just stunning!
Just wow. 10/10.
It’s free, it’s beautiful.

But now we are going to go to the Necropolis
which is just up there.

It doesn’t look as high as I thought it
was.
Beautiful day, let’s get some views.

So the Necropolis easily get’s another 10/10
for me.

Glasgow is just bringing up 10/10’s all
day, let’s see how that progresses.

I could spend so long here just wandering,
bring full camera battery, charge your phone,
you’ll want to take a lot of photos here

You’ve got the cathedral int he background,
it’s just so serene.

It’s got like 36,000 entrances into this
building so I am just going to presume it’s
one of the front ones.
Chambers tour?

(attendant) I give out the tickets at 2pm
(aly) perfect, I’ll come back then.
Thank you.

My friend MC told me about this, she is a
local Glaswegian lass.
Nice mate, nice.
I cannot believe it is almost 4pm.

Here is a UK pro tip for you, anyone not from
the UK thinking of making a visit.

If you’re on a budget, or you’re just
feeling like bit peckish, late lunch, if you

want to save up for dinner, whatever, you
don’t want to spend a fortune and go to
a restaurant.

Head to a Sainsbury’s, they are everywhere,
even in the cities, Sainsbury’s local

You can get a sandwich, crisps and a juice
for 3 quid.
Part of the meal deal.
This alone is £1.90 for an innocent smoothie,

So there you go, I am going to munch on these,
charge my devices up and I can’t wait to

go and see Glasgow at night, get some dinner
and maybe find some cool bars.

But we shall see what happens, I am going
to put my blistered feet up for just one second
and eat my avocado sandwich.

We are now on the hunt for dinner and maybe
a beverage.

I found a place called Stereo which is a really
cool little hip cafe bar which is fully vegan,
really nice staff.

My gosh the fettuccine was the creamiest I’ve
ever eaten in my life.
The end of a very interesting 3 days.

I did not expect to enjoy myself this much
on a trip around the UK but I need to do it
more, I really do

But we shall save the conclusion until I get
home later, we are going to be heading back

to the bus station just around the corner
here is Glasgow

and I’ve seen them all over the place, it’s
called the 500 bus.

Straight to the airport, and you can use contactless,
so you can just jump on with you debit card,
if it’s contactless.
you can use Apple pay and Google pay, I think.

It’s what I saw on the side of the bus but
I will double check when we get there.

Super easy, you don’t have to worry about
getting a ticket.
Go on, tap and we’re away.

Don’t know how much it is but we’ll find
that out as well.

Let’s go to Glasgow airport to get my first
ever domestic flight in the UK.
This’ll be interesting.

Right, thank you room, thank you Glasgow,
it’s been a pleasure.

Let’s go check out and jump on the bus to
the airport.
Toodles.
Aly: Hi, I’m good how are you?
Driver: Not so bad thanks.
Aly: Contactless?
Driver: Yes, single?
Aly: Yes, please.
Driver: 8.50 please.
So you save 50p if you download their app.

That’s good if you don’t have contactless
in the UK.

Just in case you’re curious, I was trying
to find the price and this flight which I
booked on the GoEuro app as well came to £102

So, we are back in Birmingham, and let’s
do a quick recap!
Best thing in Manchester?
Northern Quarter.

Absolutely, you could just spend a whole day
exploring all the pop up shops, the little

craft bars, I love it, I love that area, so
colourful and quirky.

Edinburgh, definitely put Dean Village on
your list and I really want to go back in

Autumn because I can imagine, winter is a
bit bleak but very picturesque.
But I can imagine in autumn with all the colours.
Glasgow, everything I ate in Glasgow was…
So much good food.
Did not expect that.
So just eat your heart out in Glasgow.

Now when I was putting this video together
I was noticing how the prices were fluctuating.
I got some amazing train deals.

Like my longest train was one of the cheapest
transport I booked with GoEuro
It was crazy, it was over 3 hours.

But then you get the bus for like 4.20 for
an hour and 10 minutes.

A massive thank you to GoEuro for sponsoring
this video.

I will link everything I have mentioned down
below, go and check them out, download their
app.
It’s absolutely brilliant!
Such a nice place to have all your tickets.

You can just compare buses, trains and flights
all on one page so you can see all of the
prices.
It’s fantastic, Go and show them some love.

They are brilliant and it’s definitely a
well needed app if you’re coming over to

Europe to explore or already from Europe and
you just want to explore some more of your
own, continent.

Anyway I will leave it there, this has been
a fantastic 3 day trip.
I really enjoyed it.

It gave me a really good taste for other parts
of the UK and I’ll definitely be going back

to all 3 of them at some point to explore
more.
I will see you in another video.
Alright, much love, incoming kisses, bye.
